meanings.definition: The act of abiding or obeying a rule or law.
meanings.sent1: Her abidances to the school rules were always commendable.
meanings.sent2: The abidances of the citizens to traffic laws kept the streets safe.
meanings.sent3: His abidances to the 'no eating in class' rule were tested when he found a hidden snack in his bag.
meanings.sent4: The abidances of the team to the coach's strategy led them to victory.
meanings.sent5: The strict abidances to safety protocols prevented any accidents on the construction site.

meanings.definition: The state of remaining in a particular place or condition.
meanings.sent1: The abidances of the old house gave it a sense of history.
meanings.sent2: The abidances of the cat on the windowsill made it a familiar sight in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The abidances of the sleepy town were disrupted by the arrival of a circus.
meanings.sent4: The abidances of the tree in the garden provided shade for picnics on sunny days.
meanings.sent5: The abidances of the antique clock in the hallway added a touch of elegance to the room.
